item.title: 【Albums (lossless)】Dolby Atmos - Matt Darey - Wolf - [MLP Lossless Dolby Atmos 16 ch - 7.1 ch TrueHD core 24bit 48kHz]
item.description:
Matt Darey - Wolf - Dolby Atmos with TrueHD 7.1 Core
Released: 2017
Genre: Electronic - Electronic (Progressive House, Deep House, Tech House, Progressive Trance)
Format / Quality: m4a / MLP Lossless Dolby Atmos 16 channel with 7.1 channel TrueHD core 24bit 48kHz – 4900 – 6000 kbps



This album was made specifically with dolby atmos in mind rather that after the fact. I came across it while searching out reviews for the best dolby atmos music albums. I think its worth a listen to if you appreciate surround sound music and are interested in the capabilities of dolby atmos for music or even just surround sound in general, regardless of this is your taste in music i think its worth giving a listen. I personally don't have a dolby atmos setup yet but its pretty awesome sounding in truehd 7.1.

I took this from a bluray video and extracted the atmos audio and put it in a m4a container. This plays with foobar (when setup properly, see attached image for playback with FFMPEG decoding the TrueHD 7.1 core). You can also play the ATMOS when bitstreaming through VLC and MPC-HC (tested) and presumably powerdvd among other video players. Apologies if my highlighted instructions on Foobar FFMPEG decoding of atmos is the wrong custom file format. Its one of the ones listed in the picture for sure though. You need to have copy of FFMPEG new enough that it includes dolby atmos decoding and setup foobar to be pointed to its file folder location.

https://www.mattdarey.com/post/wolfalbum



1 Wolf 0:07:00
2 Ashamed 0:06:34
